trans-unit.source: Represents a window that supports content navigation.
NavigationWindow derives from <xref:System.Windows.Window> and extends it with the ability to navigate to and display content.
Content can be any [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winfx](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winfx-md.md)] object or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_html](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-html-md.md)] file.
In general, however, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Page> object is the preferred way to package content for navigation.

Content can be navigated to by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Source%2A> property with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the desired content.

Additionally, content can be navigated to by using one of the following overloads of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> method: - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%28System.Uri%29> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%28System.Uri%2CSystem.Object%29> When content is navigated to by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)], NavigationWindow will return an object that contains the content.
> [!NOTE] > Navigation by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] also supports navigation to a content fragment.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.FragmentNavigation>.

Alternatively, content can be navigated to by using one of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> method overloads that accepts an object: - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%28System.Object%29> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%28System.Object%2CSystem.Object%29> The lifetime of a navigation can be tracked through the following events: - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigating> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigated> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationProgress> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationFailed> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationStopped> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.LoadCompleted> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.FragmentNavigation>.

Not all events are raised each time that a navigation occurs; the set of events that are raised is determined by the type of navigation that occurs (content or content fragment) and how the navigation completes (canceled, stopped, or failed).

The following figure illustrates the sequence in which these events will fire: ![Page navigation flow chart](~/add/media/navigationoverviewfigure11.png "Page navigation flow chart") During or after a navigation, NavigationWindow provides information about the content that is being navigated to, including the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the content being navigated to (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Source%2A>), the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the current content (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.CurrentSource%2A>), and an object that contains the content that was navigated to (<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A>).
When content is navigated to, NavigationWindow records the navigation as an entry in navigation history.

An entry is added to back navigation history when either a new navigation occurs, by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> method, or by navigating to an entry in forward navigation history, by calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.GoForward%2A>.
An entry is added to forward navigation history by navigating to an entry in back navigation history, by calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.GoBack%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.CanGoBack%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.CanGoForward%2A> report whether there are entries in back and forward navigation history, respectively.

The first time that one piece of content is navigated to from another piece of content, NavigationWindow automatically displays a navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] that allows users to navigate back and forwards through navigation history.

You can configure when the navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] is shown by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.ShowsNavigationUI%2A> property.
The most recent entry in back navigation history can be removed by calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.RemoveBackEntry%2A>.
NavigationWindow does not store an instance of a content object in navigation history.
Instead, NavigationWindow creates a new instance of the content object each time it is navigated to by using navigation history.
This behavior is designed to avoid excessive memory consumption when large numbers and large pieces of content are being navigated to.
Consequently, the state of the content is not remembered from one navigation to the next.
However, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] provides several techniques by which you can store a piece of state for a piece of content in navigation history.
Using <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.AddBackEntry%2A>, you can also remember multiple sets of state for a single page instance.
NavigationWindow is one of two navigators in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], the other being <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame>.
Essentially, navigator is a class supports navigation and navigation history.

Visually, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xbapsharpplural-md.md)] use [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie7](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-ie7-md.md)] as a navigator, to provide an integrated user experience.

However, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xbapsharpplural-md.md)] actually use NavigationWindow as the navigator; the <xref:System.Windows.Application.MainWindow%2A> property of an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] running in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie7](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-ie7-md.md)] will return a reference to the NavigationWindow, and the navigation history that is managed by the NavigationWindow is integrated with the navigation history that is managed by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie7](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-ie7-md.md)].
**Content Model:** NavigationWindow is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>, which means that NavigationWindow can contain content such as text, images, or panels.
Also, NavigationWindow is a root element and, consequently, cannot be part of another element's content.
For more information about the content model for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>, see [WPF Content Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Customizing the NavigationWindow Control To apply the same property settings to multiple NavigationWindow controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the NavigationWindow, see [NavigationWindow Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the control’s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in NavigationWindow control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> class.
Adds an entry to back navigation history that contains a <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState"></xref> object.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.AddBackEntry%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState"></xref> object that represents application-defined state that is associated with a specific piece of content.
state is , and a object isn't returned from .
Adds a child object.
The child object to add.
when this method is called.
This prevents content from being added to <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> using [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
Adds text to the object.
The text to add to the object.
if the text parameter value contains non-whitespace characters.
Gets an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> that you use to enumerate the entries in back navigation history for a <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref>.
The entries that are returned by BackStack include whole content, fragment navigations, and custom state.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|BackStack| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> if at least one entry has been added to back navigation history, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there are not entries or the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> does not own its own navigation history.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.BackStack*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value that indicates whether there is at least one entry in back navigation history.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.CanGoBack%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|CanGoBack| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if there is at least one entry in back navigation history; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if there are no entries in back navigation history or the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> does not own its own navigation history.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.CanGoBack*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value that indicates whether there is at least one entry in forward navigation history.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|CanGoForward| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if there is at least one entry in forward navigation history; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if there are no entries in forward navigation history, or the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> does not own its own navigation history.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.CanGoForward*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the content that was last navigated to.
See CurrentSource.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the content that was last navigated to, if navigated to by using a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)]; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> that you use to enumerate the entries in back navigation history for a <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref>.
The entries that are returned by ForwardStack include whole content, fragment navigations, and custom state.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|ForwardStack| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> if at least one entry has been added to forward navigation history, or null if there are no entries or the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> does not own its own navigation history.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.ForwardStack*> dependency property.
To be added.

Occurs when navigation to a content fragment begins, which occurs immediately, if the desired fragment is in the current content, or after the source [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_titlexaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-titlexaml-md.md)] content has been loaded, if the desired fragment is in different content.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.FragmentNavigation?displayProperty=fullName>.
To be added.
Navigates to the most recent item in back navigation history.
GoBack is called when there are no entries in back navigation history.
Navigates to the most recent item in forward navigation history.
GoForward is called when there are no entries in forward navigation history.
Occurs when content that was navigated to has been loaded, parsed, and has begun rendering.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.LoadCompleted?displayProperty=fullName>.
To be added.
Navigates asynchronously to content that is contained by an object.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%28System.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName>.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the content to navigate to.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a navigation is not canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Navigates asynchronously to content that is specified by a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)].
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%28System.Uri%29?displayProperty=fullName>.
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri#initcap#plural](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-urisharpinitcapsharpplural-md.md)] can be either relative or absolute.
For more information, see [Pack URIs in WPF](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref:System.Uri> object initialized with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the desired content.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a navigation is not canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Navigates asynchronously to content that is contained by an object, and passes an object that contains data to be used for processing during navigation.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%28System.Object%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName>.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the content to navigate to.
A <xref:System.Object> that contains data to be used for processing during navigation.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a navigation is not canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Navigates asynchronously to source content located at a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)], and pass an object that contains data to be used for processing during navigation.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%28System.Uri%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref:System.Uri> object initialized with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the desired content.
A <xref:System.Object> that contains data to be used for processing during navigation.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a navigation is not canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Occurs when the content that is being navigated to has been found, and is available from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content*> property, although it may not have completed loading.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigated?displayProperty=fullName>.
To be added.
Occurs when a new navigation is requested.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigating?displayProperty=fullName>.
To be added.
Occurs when an error is raised while navigating to the requested content.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.NavigationFailed?displayProperty=fullName>.
To be added.
Occurs periodically during a download to provide navigation progress information.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.NavigationProgress?displayProperty=fullName>.
To be added.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService"></xref> that is used by this <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> to provide navigation services to its content.

<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> uses a <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService> to provide navigation services to content that is hosted by <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>.

The NavigationService property is useful for code in a custom <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> to get a reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService>, to handle navigation events, for example.

Content that is hosted by a <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Page>, should use the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.GetNavigationService%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Page.NavigationService%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get a reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService>.
The navigation service used by this <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.StopLoading*> method is called, or when a new navigation is requested while a current navigation is in progress.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.NavigationStopped?displayProperty=fullName>.
To be added.
Called when the template generation for the visual tree is created.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Window.Closed"></xref> event.
OnClosed releases the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService> object that it is using to manage navigation, before raising <xref:System.Windows.Window.Closed> event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Creates and returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.NavigationWindowAutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.NavigationWindowAutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref>.
Reloads the current content.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Refresh%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Removes the most recent journal entry from back history.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.RemoveBackEntry%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The most recent <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry"></xref> in back navigation history, if there is one.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> isolates external [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] content within a partial trust security sandbox (with default Internet zone permission set).

External content is [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] content that is not included with an application as either a resource file or a content file (for more information, see [WPF Application Resource, Content, and Data Files](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)).

When SandboxExternalContent is true, and the content of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> is an external [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] file, the content is loaded into a partial trust security sandbox that is limited to the default Internet zone permission set.
Additionally, the external content is loaded into a separate process.

Consequently, the external content becomes isolated and does not have access to application-scope resources, such as resource dictionaries (for more information, see <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>).

> [!NOTE] > <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> contains external content only when the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Source%2A> property is set to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] for an external [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] file.

<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> content that is provided using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> property is considered internal content and, subsequently, is not isolated.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|SandboxExternalContent| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if content is isolated within a partial trust security sandbox; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
SandboxExternalContent is set when an application is executing in partial trust.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.SandboxExternalContent*> dependency property.
To be added.
Indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content*> property should be persisted.
This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> property does not have a simple default value.
This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value.

You typically call this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref> shows its navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].

To aid back and forward navigation, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> automatically displays a navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] Navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] is displayed whether or not navigation has occurred.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|ShowsNavigationUI| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] is displayed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.ShowsNavigationUI*> dependency property.
To be added.

Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the current content, or the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of new content that is currently being navigated to.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Source%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri#initcap#plural](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-urisharpinitcapsharpplural-md.md)] can be either relative or absolute.
For more information, see [Pack URIs in WPF](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|Source| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the current content, or the content that is currently being navigated to.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Source*> dependency property.
To be added.
Stops further downloading of content for the current navigation request.
StopLoading stops the download of the requested content, and causes the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationStopped> event to be raised.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.StopLoading%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Gets or sets the base uniform resource identifier (URI) of the current context.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext> interface.
The base URI of the current context.
